heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 34.3mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 24.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 47.89mm.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (213°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 557m to 849m and averaged 728.4m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, overcast skies with low cloud, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
